snippet: As Venezuelans prepare for presidential elections on Sunday, Willie Colón, a salsa star, has contributed a song that skewers Nicolás Maduro, picked by Hugo Chávez to be his successor.
abstract: Willie Colon, Bronx-born salsa star with Puerto Rican roots, posts online recording of tune that skewers Venezuelan presidential candidate Nicolas Maduro, picked by Hugo Chavez to be his successor; without naming Maduro outright, song refers to him as 'Fresh Lies,' nickname that opposition candidate Henrique Capriles Radonski has adopted for his opponent.
lead_paragraph: As Venezuelans prepare for presidential elections on Sunday, Willie Colón, a salsa star, has contributed a song that skewers Nicolás Maduro, picked by Hugo Chávez to be his successor.

headline.seo: Song by Willie Colón Targets Nicolás Maduro in Venezuela
headline.main: Star Hurls Musical Barbs Before Venezuela’s Vote
headline.print_headline: Star Hurls Musical Barbs Before Venezuela’s Vote
